ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you are interested in changing notions of sovereignty, law, and politics, then this course is a very good choice.
I would recommend the course to anyone interested in the fundamental questions related to sovereignty and world politics.

This course is such a broad handling of the topic of sovereignty that it is quite fast paced, but you will feel very comfortable with the topic when you are done. It is practical and deeply philosophical at the same time. A great course. Theorists and empirical pol. scientists should both take this course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I now have a much better understanding of the concept of sovereignty, and that's what the course was all about.
This course deepened my knowledge considerably of the political science subfield of contemporary political theory.

This course was key for me, I am working in Political Theory, and so most of the materials are directly on topic with my interests. Those interested in Europe and European thought will find this course to be important.
